      • exportToExcel2007

        public void exportToExcel2007(OutputStream output)
                       throws I18nException
        This method will write all messages in the datasource in MS Excel 2007 format to the provided OutputStream. For more details about the format refer to the ExcelWriter
        Specified by:
        exportToExcel2007 in interface MessageManagementService
        Parameters:
        output - a Stream where the excel content should be written to, be sure to close the stream after this operation.
        Throws:
        I18nException - when something technically went wrong
        See Also:
        MessageManagementService.exportToExcel2007(java.io.OutputStream)

      • exportToExcel97

        public void exportToExcel97(OutputStream output)
                     throws I18nException
        Be careful: Do not use a BufferedOutputStream for this implementation. This method will write all messages in the datasource in MS Excel 97 format to the provided OutputStream. For more details about the format refer to the ExcelWriter
        Specified by:
        exportToExcel97 in interface MessageManagementService
        Parameters:
        output - a Stream where the excel content should be written to DO NOT use a BufferedOutputStream here (Assertion will fail since the library has a problem with this), be sure to close the stream after this operation.
        Throws:
        I18nException - when something technically went wrong
        See Also:
        MessageManagementService.exportToExcel97(java.io.OutputStream)

      • exportToText

      • importFromExcel

        public void importFromExcel(InputStream input)
                     throws I18nException
        This method will read all messages form the MS Excel file content provided as InputStream. The workbook version (97/2007) will be detected automatically from the content. For more details about the format refer to the ExcelReader
        Specified by:
        importFromExcel in interface MessageManagementService
        Parameters:
        input - an open and valid input stream, be sure to close the stream after this operation.
        Throws:
        I18nException - when something technically went wrong
        See Also:
        MessageManagementService.importFromExcel(java.io.InputStream)
